DataElement.preferredName: Disease or Disorder Nephrectomy Mastectomy Interval Disease-Free Survival Duration
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the period of time of disease-free survival, the period of time between nephrectomy, surgery to remove a kidney, or mastectomy, surgical removal of the breast, in which there is no appearance of the symptoms or effects of the disease, and current treatment.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Disease or Disorder Nephrectomy Mastectomy Interval Disease-Free Survival
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the disease-free survival, period of time between nephrectomy, surgery to remove a kidney, or mastectomy, surgical removal of the breast, in which there is no appearance of the symptoms or effects of the disease, and current treatment.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A definite pathologic process with a characteristic set of signs and symptoms. It may affect the whole body or any of its parts, and its etiology, pathology, and prognosis may be known or unknown.

Concepts.definition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Property.preferredDefinition: (nef-REK-toe-mee) Surgery to remove a kidney. Radical nephrectomy removes the kidney, the adrenal gland, nearby lymph nodes, and other surrounding tissue. Simple nephrectomy removes only the kidney. Partial nephrectomy removes the tumor but not the entire kidney.:Surgical removal of the breast.:The period of time or the distance separating two instances, events, or occurrences.:Period after successful treatment in which there is no appearance of the symptoms or effects of the disease.

Concepts.definition: A surgical procedure to completely or partially remove a kidney. With a complete nephrectomy, the attached adrenal gland, perinephric fat, and regional lymph nodes are often removed as well. With a partial nephrectomy, the removed tissue contains the tumor and a rim of normal renal parenchyma only.
The period of time or the distance separating two instances, events, or occurrences.
The length of time after treatment for a specific disease during which a patient survives with no sign of recurrence of the disease.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the response criteria (includes RECIST and others) and associated documentation of disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The period of time of disease-free survival.

PermissibleValues.value: Less than or equal to one year
